ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: remaining in it for countless aeons,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Where they will remain for aeons,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: therein they shall abide for ages,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: for the rebellious ones and they will live therein for ages.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They will remain in it for ages.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They will abide therein for ages.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: where they shall remain for ages,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They will tarry therein for ages.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They will dwell therein for ages.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They will abide therein for ages,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: there, they shall live for ages,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Where they will remain for eons.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: In which they will remain for ages [unending].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [78:23] to remain (lābithīna is an implied circumstantial qualifier, in other words, their remaining therein will be decreed [to be]) therein for ages, for endless epochs (ahqāb is the plural of huqb),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They will abide therein for ages) they will abide in the Fire for ages and ages, each age consisting of 80 years, each year being 360 days and each day is the equivalent of 1,000 years of the years of the life of the world; it is also said that none knows the exact duration of these ages save Allah, and therefore these ages are never interrupted.
